intro:
Idiot.

There is no meaning of life.

Love Linux, KDE, Qt, Open Source and Free (as speech) software, Python, Pirate Party, ZeroNet and other awesome technologies, ideas, projects and software that respect our rights, freedom, privacy and anonimity.

Links:
-[ My main ZeroSite](http://127.0.0.1:43110/ZAlex.bit/)
-[ ZeroMail](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Mail.ZeroNetwork.bit/?to=zalex@zeroid.bit)
-[ ClearNet site](http://zausoft.ru)
-[ E-Mail](mailto:zalex@zausoft.ru)

post.body: Hello ZeroMe!

![Image test](http://zausoft.ru/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/60.png)
(Need image pasting feature)

Have you seen my new [website](http://zausoft.ru) about [PocketMod](http://127.0.0.1:43110/pocketmod.bit)? It is not very informative, but I'll fix it for release.
What do you think, which site is better?
Just found an amazing ZeroSite - [Zatogra](http://127.0.0.1:43110/zatogra.bit/)
Русскоязычные ЗероНетчики, желаете ли вы продолжения [Блокнота Шизофреника](http://127.0.0.1:43110/shiza.zalex.bit/)? Пара идей для размышлений есть, но нужно ли оно вам?
[We don't need a paid Photoshop!](http://127.0.0.1:43110/blog.zalex.bit/?Post:14)

@Testset: as I remember, you wanted folding instructions for [PocketMod](http://zausoft.ru).
So, [I'm working on it](http://127.0.0.1:43110/blog.zalex.bit/?Post:15).

Just generated a *wonderful* `.onion` domain using [Shallot](https://github.com/katmagic/Shallot): `putin4madxx7h3bl6.onion`
Well, who wants to get a "putin mad" TOR\Onion domain for free? xD

Check out new release of amazing Python IDE - [Spyder 3.0](https://github.com/spyder-ide/spyder)
`pip install spyder`

Finally I found a program for taking notes that I love:

> [QOwnNotes](http://qownnotes.org) is the open source (GPL) notepad with markdown support and todo list manager for GNU/Linux and Windows, that (optionally) works together with the notes application of ownCloud\Nextcloud.

> You are able to view and edit notes from your mobile device (like with CloudNotes) or by the ownCloud web-service.

> The notes are stored as plain text files and you can sync them with your ownCloud sync client or other software, like Dropbox, Syncthing, Seafile or BitTorrent Sync.
Just registered [yandex.bit](http://127.0.0.1:43110/yandex.bit) domain :D

The Syberia 3 release was postponed to the first quarter of 2017
D:

Have you watched the cartoon "Mary And Max" (2009)?
If not, try it. And then share your impressions here, I really want to hear your opinion.

I hope this is only a temporary solution of registration by ZeroID (./js/js.all):
`return $.post("https://demo.zeronet.io/ZeroID/request.php"...`
Registration via BM also centralized because there is a script `./publisher-bitmessage/bitmessage.py`, and as I understand it, nofish runs this script to accept incoming requests.

I am checking ZeroMail every day but today suddenly I get some "new" emails that were sent in early October.
O_o

Congratulations!

> Pirate Party of Russia congratulates the Pirate Party of Iceland with success in the last elections to the Parliament. Iceland Pirate Party won 10 seats in parliament, sharing second place with the Left-Green Movement, and became one of the leading political forces in the country. This is the largest representation of "pirates" in parliament among all countries and we are looking forward to the success of our colleagues, we believe that it will positively affect the success of the pirate movement and the Pirate parties will get more credence on the part of society.
> 
> Freedom! Equality! Piracy!

Today I went to the bank to cash out my first scholarship. The bank employee said that I need *government permission* to cash any money from **my** account, since I'm not 18 years old. I have no right to get my money. I need to collect a bunch of references. I need to apply to the guardianship. I need lots of time to stand in queues to collect these documents.
Russia is a country of "great" opportunities.

That's why I love cryptocurrencies (Bitcoin, etc.). It's based on math, not on "paper". My wallet isn't dependents on government and banks. I am the **only** owner of my money.
Remember, remember the [fifth of November](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guy_Fawkes_Night)...
Have you seen my [photo album](http://127.0.0.1:43110/zalex.bit/photos/index.html) at [ZAlex.bit](http://127.0.0.1:43110/zalex.bit)? :D
Neo in Russia...
When overlocked Raspberry Pi and forgot about cooling...
**UPD.** openSUSE 42.2 is [available for download](http://opensuse.org/)!

Meanwhile in Russia:
Teachers are forcing students to give scholarship to the University in Belgorod. One blogger has accused the University of corruption, and he is now judged for it. - [Open Russia](http://openrussia.org/post/view/19790/)
How to solve problems with installing [Linux to ThinkPad](http://127.0.0.1:43110/blog.zalex.bit/?Post:16)
[Qwant](https://www.qwant.com/) - a (clearnet) search engine, which I really like.
[Don't open if you're love Apple](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SbmgV7Oyp0w)
How do you spend your winter vacation? :D

[**PineBook**](https://www.pine64.org/?page_id=3707) - Light and Thin 64-bit ARM based **Open Source** Notebook!

The energy-efficient ARM processor with a such powerful battery (**10 000 mAh**) ensures a **really** long life without power.

I'm not a gamer, so it will be enough for my needs. One question - **how** did they achieve such low ($99) price? Now I know how to spend my scholarship! \^o^/

## PocketMod Reloaded - Beta Testing!
*[What is PocketMod?](http://zausoft.ru)*
Well, I need some brave testers!
**1. Download**
[Linux\Source Code](http://zausoft.ru/PocketMod-0.3b.tar.gz)
[Windows\Installer](http://zausoft.ru/PocketMod-0.3b-setup.exe)
**2. Install**
Linux: install dependencies `sudo pip3 install PyQt5 markdown pillow` (some packages are available in repositories, eg. `python3-qt5`), unpack archive, `python3 start.py`
Windows: just run installer
**3. Report**
Write E-Mail to [zalex@zausoft.ru](mailto:zalex@zausoft.ru) with subject `PocketMod Beta-Test` and tell *everything*: what is working, what isn't working, are there any freezes\lags, what you don't like, which plugins would you like to add, any suggestions, etc.
GitHub, PyPI, setup.py, new website - later.
**P.S.** It contains **very-very-very** bad source code.
:D
[NotABug](http://notabug.org/) - really cool GitHib-like code hosting service service, but fully FOSS (Free\Libre) and with private repositories!
[The Right to Read](https://www.gnu.org/philosophy/right-to-read.html): A Dystopian Short Story by Richard Stallman
Does anyone know what is the reason for increasing the price of **Litecoin**? About an year Litecoin was worth ~4 USD, but a few days ago it **suddenly** began to grow. Now it's ~9 USD for 1 LTC.

Russia - censorship and surveillance in one package! Just look at this nasty attempt of [MITM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Man-in-the-middle_attack). Cryptocurrencies and sites about them (eg. BTC-E) are de facto banned in Russia, although the law doesn't prohibit them.
[Awesome Gamedev](https://notabug.org/Calinou/awesome-gamedev) - a huge collection of **free software** and **free culture resources** for making amazing games.

# Attention!

**Very bad news from ~~totalitarian~~ Russia.** *Dmitry Bogatov* was arrested **because he is the owner of the Tor exit-node**. Links: in [English](https://meduza.io/en/feature/2017/04/10/mathematics-teacher-accused-of-inciting-mass-riots-now-also-accused-of-supporting-terrorism-and-once-again-detained), but a bit outdated info; [more actual article](https://geektimes.ru/post/287944/), but in Russian
**[Dmitry](http://sinsekvu.github.io/pages/about.html)** is the Free software activist and programmer, teacher of mechanics and mathematics, vegetarian and pacifist. Police said that he called people to participate in an opposition rally, **just because of the coincidence of IP addresses.**
This is the first known case of the arrest of the Tor-node operator in Russia.

*Did you know?*
[Two women in Russia are in the prison](https://meduza.io/news/2017/04/11/osuzhdennyh-za-sms-zhitelnits-sochi-pereveli-v-lefortovo) for sending an SMS.
Shortly before the [conflict in South Ossetia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russo-Georgian_War), they were sent SMS messages (to Georgia) about the Russian military equipment that was seen on the railroad. They were charged with treason. One woman was sentenced to 12 years of imprisonment, other for 8 years.

In the Russian Parliament [submitted](https://meduza.io/cards/v-dumu-vnesli-zakonoproekt-o-zhestkom-regulirovanii-sotssetey-ego-primut) a bill to the **full control over the social networks**. they want to make the registration on such sites age-restricted and only on the passport.
Thank you, **ZeroMe**! You're completely independent from our idiotic government.

Russian Parliament introduced another [insane bill](https://meduza.io/cards/kak-vlasti-hotyat-rasshirit-prava-politsii). They want to give the police an awful lot of authority: the inspection of the person, his personal belongings and home; **breaking and entering** in the cars, **houses** and other private property; **shooting at public events (!)** - and all this **without any reason**, if they deem it necessary. **Without orders and permission** of the court.
@nofish: the save button disappears.

Russian opposition activist **Vyacheslav Maltsev [was arrested](https://meduza.io/news/2017/04/13/v-saratove-zaderzhan-politik-vyacheslav-maltsev-ego-kvartiru-vskryli-bolgarkoy)**. His house was broken into and he was taken away in an unknown direction. 

**UPD:** Maltsev [had](https://meduza.io/news/2017/04/13/u-maltseva-sluchilsya-serdechnyy-pristup-posle-zaderzhaniya) a heart attack after the arrest. He can't speak. He was sent to a Moscow hospital by plane.

The situation in Russia is getting worse. After [demonstrations against corruption](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2017_Russian_protests), the authorities began mass arrests of protesters, opposition activists and even random people. What does it mean? It means that **corruption is the "core"** of the Russian government.

**I want to know your opinion**. Do you want to continue to read posts about current events "from the trenches"? Does it interesting for you? 
Write comments, please.

The authorities of the Russian region Chechnya [**threatened to kill the journalists**](https://openrussia.org/notes/708479/) of "Novaya Gazeta" because they wrote articles about discrimination against homosexuals and human rights violations.
Also, the head of this region published in social networks photos of the opposition politicians in the crosshairs of the sniper.

It seems that there are no good news from Russia, [only bad](https://meduza.io/feature/2017/04/16/oni-privykli-chto-oni-lyudi-poslednego-sorta-im-etu-mysl-vnushili).
After the mass arrests of homosexuals (about **150-200** people) **several killed**, many were maimed and said about **torture via electric chair**.

> "He shows me his hands and there he has a strange invasive injury. It's not a burn, not a cut. I've never seen anything like this. And it turns out that this *injury from electric current*. They hook up some "clothespins", 220 volts, and these places, where they are attached, affects the most. Now, it looks like this deep eczema that goes into the muscle, I don't even know how to explain it."
Sad that I live in a such horrible country.

[Roskomnadzor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_Service_for_Supervision_in_the_Sphere_of_Telecom,_Information_Technologies_and_Mass_Communications) (the Russian Federal Agency responsible for censorship of the Internet) [asked](https://geektimes.ru/post/288166/) VPN providers to block sites that are banned in Russia.

If someone will again talk about the difficulties of working in Free\Libre software, I will remember [this short story](http://bash.im/quote/444461).
> Sometimes using of Open Office is hell. In the Excel, all dates are automatically converted according to the template, but in OOo 31st of Apri is displayed as the full date, not abbreviated. The rest of the dates are converted automatically, but this date is not converted. And if I write 30th day, then everything works. Although, stop. How I got **31st of April? Dammit!..**

**Bad news from my town!** Teachers **forced** me to go for a **militaristic rally**. There was a song with the words "we are for Putin!". I was forcibly brought. I went to the other end of the square, sat on a bench with the Pacific ☮ on clothing. Maybe I'll tell more if I find the video of this event.

Меня, как и многих других студентов, принудительно сняли с пар и пойти на сомнительный митинг милитаристской тематики, где играла песня с припевом "Мы за Путина!". Уйти я не мог, так что, отошёл немного, сел на скамейку и закрепил на одежде Пацифик.

> «Patriotism is, fundamentally, a conviction that a particular country is the best in the world because you were born in it...»
- George Bernard Shaw.

> «Патриотизм — это ваше убеждение, что ваша страна лучше всех остальных только потому, что вы в ней родились...»
- Джордж Бернард Шоу.

[Anti-patriotism](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anti-patriotism) / [Антипатриотизм](https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/Антипатриотизм)

**Sony PlayStation 4** [was recognized](https://rublacklist.net/27951/) by the Russian customs as **"encryption tool"**. Customs says that the product is an encryption device if it can implement cryptographic algorithms, **regardless of whether it's main purpose or not**. Now the man who ordered PlayStation from Germany will be fined, and his console is confiscated.
**[Polyethylene bio-degradation by caterpillars of the wax moth](http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.cub.2017.02.060)**

I do not like any kind of psychological tests, because many of them are quite obvious to me. But the ["16 Personalities Test"](https://www.16personalities.com/) surprised me very much. I expected to see in the results obvious things like "phlegmatic, introvert", etc. but I got something much more. I read a lot of things that I did not notice in myself before. Especially about my vulnerabilities and weaknesses.
P.S. I am the [INFJ](https://www.16personalities.com/infj-personality) (“The Advocate”)

Bad news from Russia: Leftist activists and vegans [were detained](https://meduza.io/news/2017/05/01/na-shestvii-v-moskve-zaderzhali-veganov-i-levyh-aktivistov) at demonstrations in Moscow. They passed through the center of the city with the banner "Animals are not food".

Bad news from Russia: The [Roskomnadzor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_Service_for_Supervision_in_the_Sphere_of_Telecom%2C_Information_Technologies_and_Mass_Communications) [**began to quietly block the messengers**](https://rublacklist.net/28213/) that refuse to compromise users and cooperate with government. They decided to start with *less popular applications*, but this is just the beginning... Blocked apps: BlackBerry Messenger (BBM), LINE, Imo.im, Vchat. Also, Zello and Linkedin were previously blocked.
My college again forces us to participate in militaristic rallies, under the threat that we won't be allowed to take exams. Damn it.

Meanwhile in Russia, **20th of April**
>xxx: Now I know the only correct answer to the question, why do trees drop leaves for the winter. Because the layer of snow that has settled on the leaves can easily break a tree.
>yyy: And where did you read this?
>xxx: Nowhere. I just looked out the window.
I finally received a coupon for buying a [Pinebook](https://www.pine64.org/?page_id=3707), but *now*... I have absolutely no money for it `._.`

What is the optimal size (width and height) of avatar?
Upd: 50x50 px?
Check out my music too - ZAlex.bit

GPG?
@Scrub: Maybe, never heard of this website.

Somebody posted a big image (?) and now Zatogra can't update for me :(
(1 file update failed)
UPD: Oh, this is big (4 MB) gif animation...
Wow, ZeroHello automatically create short links without "127.0.0.1:43110", if you go there through http://zeronetwork.bit
@Tkarita: No, I had problems due to slow network bandwidth.
Can we get in future something like this [http://127.0.0.1:43110/1JouSggdhsEZ9tWN5oiQArjdAA8wkCcxuR/ ] in our ZeroHello newsfeed?
@Nofish: ZeroMe updated ~50 minuter ago, what is changed? :D

@Quadrangle: Using free alternatives you inflict more damage on the companies than using pirated software. IMHO. If once you don't have a choice (only legal software), then you have to buy the program, or painful get used to another.
@Quadrangle: Also, Photoshop is not available for Linux.
@Tkarita: because someone incorrectly configured clock

In the sidebar - try to drag a circle-button with zero (0) to left.
Or directly in content.js
I'm not alone here, with my openSUSE :D
And russian forum too - http://127.0.0.1:43110/rutalk.bit
`NO PEERS FOUND`
О, теперь открылось. Кстати, домен `zerro.bit` свободен для регистрации.
Отсыпать чуток NMC, чтоб на будущее зарегистрировать?

[Quoting Nofish](http://127.0.0.1:43110/me.zeronetwork.bit/?Post/1RedkCkVaXuVXrqCMpoXQS29bwaqsuFdL/1F6BMqittjWUStzUbRXm2kG2GQ3RdBLqFQ/5):

> no official way, but you can: open javascript console (F12), choose inner-frame from dropdown, enter: Page.cmd("dbQuery", "SELECT json.user_name FROM follow LEFT JOIN json USING (json_id) WHERE follow.user_name = 'GomZik'")
ИМХО, не вижу тут федеративности, ибо нет центрального сайта. Под центральным имеешь ввиду саму "морду" ZeroMe? Так вообще не проблема сделать альтернативный "GUI", как ZeroMe Plus или ZeroMe Dark.
Мне не очень понравился официальный дубляж на русский. В первый раз я смотрел этот мультфильм с пиратским одноголосным переводом, рекомендую разыскать именно такой вариант, оно того стоит.
Also, ["Nanasi text board"](http://127.0.0.1:43110/16KzwuSAjFnivNimSHuRdPrYd1pNPhuHqN/) uses `bitcoinjs` for generating certs. So, a fully decentralized registration service is possible.
Goodbye, [Zatogra](http://127.0.0.1:43110/zatogra.bit), because now we have ZeroMe with **full** images support!
What height and width is the most optimal?
And will you merge some features (blocklist, tags, comment liking) from ZeroMe Plus?
@It's a test!: [ZeroMux](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1CiDoBP8RiWziqiBGEd8tQMy66A6fmnw2V/big/docs/)
@ulrichard: It's a [Telegram](https://telegram.org) bot - **@Icon8bot** that stylizing images using neural networks
@It's a test!: this is a modified scene from the Matrix :D
@It's a test!: openSUSE != SUSE (Enterprise)

I can download zip file, but can't open D:
Seems that this archive is damaged. I tried to open it using ark and peazip
@Firebox: Mozilla Firefox 50 (on openSUSE Linux)
@Firebox: Thanks, now it works!

@Nofish: Has contributors transferred their rights of patches to you?
@ulrichard: [Curated Pine64 OS Images](http://wiki.pine64.org/index.php/Main_Page#Curated_Pine_A64_.28A64.2B.29_OS_Images)

And [how to do this](http://127.0.0.1:43110/blog.zalex.bit/?Post:12) without blocking Clearnet traffic.

Yeeeess! I really wanted this!
Seems like no one wants to test it :D
@公共: Oh, and I didn't think that it will be read by those who are not subscribed to me. **Thank you for your comment**, I added a link to the description in the post.
@Sick: Of course! You can download high-res [here](https://yadi.sk/i/iAa2h0q13Ez9J9) [CC-BY-SA]

@Cnocg: I can't find it, can you please provide a link? Then I'll definitely try this :D
@Erneraude: `¯\_(ツ)_/¯`

> ZeroMe hubs are centralised... ZeroNet sites are decentralised...
@Mynameislegion: No, hubs are decentralised just like regular ZeroNet sites, and hosted by the users too.
@Mobile: I think it's in the plans of our government. They are slowly blocking more and more popular and significant sites. This is only the beginning...

Most detailed and actual [article](https://openrussia.org/notes/708374/) (in Russian). 
Someone under the name "Airat Bashirov" **used Tor** to post on the forum anti-government posts. In fact, there are about **hundreds** of IP addresses used by him, including, for example, Japanese or Dutch. But "comrade major" do not want to go abroad, right? By an unlucky coincidence he finds the address in Moscow where there is a **Tor exit-node**. So a lover of Esperanto, pacifist and vegetarian, absolutely random man now in the jail. At that time, when Dmitry was in court, Airat continued to write messages on the forum.

Incompetent Russian police believe that the IP is equal to identity and it is enough to blame the person that he has left that message. Idiots. Also, they found on his computer *a program called Tor* and said that Dimitry was using it to hide his identity.
There is no presumption of innocence in Russia.
[More fresh info](https://rublacklist.net/27509/)
@Avoiddowntime: ?
OK, I understand. I will write only about important new (as arrest of Dmitry Bogatov).

@Ranxerox: Even the Russian mainstream mass media did not cover it properly. But if they talk about these events, they do it only from the point of view of the Kremlin. For example, they condemn the demonstrations against corruption; they're making people think  that Dmitry Bogatov is a dangerous man, almost a terrorist; lying about the occupation of Crimea, calling it "voluntary" and more...

@Avoiddowntime: facepalm. Ну хоть бы [Научпока](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=B9Nngwn9EF8) посмотрел, что-ли? Ну а что-то более серъёзное и научное, вероятно, будет трудно для твоего понимания, судя по комментариям. Если подойти к диете необдуманно, то будут неприятные последствия, но при чём тут вегетарианство и недостаток белка, а уж тем более - умственные отклонения?
P.S. Искренне надеюсь, что это была шутка :D

@Avoiddowntime: какая бы сторона не приводила любые научные работы - они влёт оскверняются проивником псевдонаучными, "и вообще это лишь твое мнение, а мое доказано". Ну хватит уже, всё-таки тут речь об аресте Дмитрия, а не холивар.
Debian Project - [Statement concerning the arrest of Dmitry Bogatov](https://www.debian.org/News/2017/20170417.en.html)
Also, one teacher conducting propaganda against [Conscientious objectors](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conscientious_objector); he criticized students who refuse to go to military training camps.
@ulrichard: Yes, I feel something similar.
